issue.title: Improvements in CLI generated Webpack config

repository.name: cli
repository.description: The Aurelia 1 command line tool. Use the CLI to create projects, scaffold components, and bundle your app for release.

issue.body:
**I'm submitting a feature request**
Improvement of generated webpack config in relation to bundle splitting, long term cachability and other aspects inline with the following document:
https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/webpack/

* **Loader/bundler:**
Webpack (v4)

**Current behavior:**
Webpack config is not optimised

* **What is the expected behavior?**
Webpack config should have some basic level of optimisation and documentation should cover more advanced optimisations.

* **What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
To provide an improved out of the box development experience.

Following on from this: https://github.com/aurelia/cli/issues/958 i have learned more about webpack optimisations and tested some configs against different code both Aurelia and non-Aurelia.

Chunk splitting seems to be one of the most important aspects of optimisation provided that we are already using minification of both js and css.

The CLI generated webpack config does js minification in production mode as it enabled by default in webpack v4 but does not perform CSS minification without an additional plugin.

I will talk about chunk splitting first with some test results.

body:
@sokra Why is this closed? That pull request only fixes one of the issues documented here.

The hang during build remains when using maxSize at cacheGroups level.
`splitChunks.cacheGroups[x].maxSize`

The issue of the empty chunks being created for un-splittable modules also remains.

I could have logged the empty chunk issue as a separate issue but as its also related to maxSize i decided not to.
